meanings.definition: Capable of being saved or recovered.
meanings.sent1: The old car was salvageable after some repairs.
meanings.sent2: The damaged book was still salvageable with a little care.
meanings.sent3: The lost toy became salvageable again when it was found under the bed.
meanings.sent4: Her hope was like a salvageable treasure buried deep within her heart.
meanings.sent5: The sunken ship was a symbol of something salvageable amidst the wreckage.

meanings.definition: Able to be rescued or restored.
meanings.sent1: The injured bird was salvageable and could be nursed back to health.
meanings.sent2: The historic building was deemed salvageable and would undergo renovation.
meanings.sent3: The situation seemed dire, but there was a salvageable solution waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: His reputation was tarnished, but it was salvageable with sincere apologies.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was a reminder of the past, yet still salvageable for future generations.
